condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 1 | Description :The Borrower shall through MoECI, carry out Part 3 of the Project in accordancewith the procedures set forth in the MoECI Project Operations Manual (POM) and shall ensure that the POM is not amended, suspended,abrogated, or repealed and that no provision of the POM is waived without prior approval of the Bank.

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 2 | Description :The Borrower shall, through MoECI, maintain throughout the duration of theProject, the MoECI PIU in a form and with functions, staffing, (qualifications and scope of responsibilities) and adequateresources, all satisfactory to the Bank and as further set forth in the MoECI POM.

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 3 (break-even) | Description :The Borrower shall: (a) ensure that, starting from Fiscal Year 2015and each year thereafter, the National Energy and Utilities Regulatory Commission (NEURC) shall establish and maintain tariffssufficient for the Project Implementing Entity to cover its financial needs for carrying out of operations and debt service in atimely manner; (b) cause Energomarket to distribute funds due from Energomar | Due Date :01-Jan-2015

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 4 | Description :The Borrower, through MoECI, shall ensure, and shall cause the ProjectImplementing Entity to ensure, that the Project is carried out in accordance with the Environmental Management Plan (EMP), andshall not amend, suspend, abrogate, repeal or waive any provision of the EMP, without prior written approval of the Bank.

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 5 | Description :The Borrower shall ensure that no works under the Project involve the involuntarytaking of land resulting in relocation or loss of shelter, loss of assets or access to assets, loss of income sources or means oflivelihood, or involving the involuntary restriction of access to legally designated Parks and Protected Areas.

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 6 | Description :The Borrower shall, through MoECI, ensure that PIE: (a) No later than December 31of every year during the implementation of the Project, beginning on December 31, 2015, prepare and furnish to the Bank aprocurement progress report, in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, which shall include, inter alia: (i) a description ofissues arising during the full procurement cycle under the Project.

Finance Agreement :LA: Covenant 7 | Description :The Borrower shall, through MoECI, ensure that PIE: (b) No later than January 31of every year during the implementation of the Project, beginning on January 31, 2016, exchange views with the Bank on the resultsof the Procurement Progress Report completed for the Borrower's previous calendar year and thereafter implement such recommendedmeasures, as agreed with the Bank. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 1 | Description :PIE carry out its Respective Part of the Project in accordance with its POM,maintain its PIU throughout the duration of the Project for this purpose, in a form and with functions, staffing (withqualifications and scope of responsibilities), and adequate resources, all satisfactory to the Bank and as further set forth in itsPOM. PIE shall not amend, suspend without prior approval of the Bank.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 2 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall exercise its rights under the SubsidiaryAgreement in such manner as to protect the interests of the Borrower and the Bank and to accomplish the purposes of the Loan.Except as the Bank shall otherwise agree, the Project Implementing Entity shall not assign, amend, abrogate, or waive theSubsidiary Agreement or any of its provisions.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 3 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall carry out its Respective Part of the Projectin accordance with the EMP, and shall not amend, suspend, abrogate, repeal, or waive any provision of the EMP, without priorwritten approval of the Bank.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 4 | Description :The Project Implementing Entity shall ensure that no works under the Projectinvolve the involuntary taking of land resulting in relocation or loss of shelter, loss of assets or access to assets, loss ofincome sources or means of livelihood, or involving the involuntary restriction of access to legally designated Parks and ProtectedAreas.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 5 | Description :PIE shall not incur any debt, unless the net revenues of the PIE for the FYimmediately preceding the date of such incurrence or for a later twelve month period ended prior to the date of such incurrence,whichever is the greater, shall be at least 1.2 times the estimated maximum debt service requirements of the PIE for any succeedingFY on all debt of the PIE, including the debt to be incurred.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 6 (self-financing) | Description :PIE shall: (a) produce, for each of its FYs after its FY endingon FY 2015, funds from internal sources equivalent to not less than 25% of the annual avg of its capital expenditures incurred, orexpected to be incurred, for that year, the previous FY and the next five following Fiscal Years.

Finance Agreement :PA: Covenant 7 (Self-financing) | Description :PIE shall: (b) before December 31 in each of its fiscal years,the Project Implementing Entity shall, on the basis of forecasts prepared by the Project Implementing Entity and satisfactory tothe Bank, review whether it would meet the requirements set forth in (a) in respect of such year and the next following fiscal yearand shall furnish to the Bank a copy of such review upon its completion.

Finance Agreement :PA: Relating to Covenant 7 (Self-financing) | Description :If any such review shows that the ProjectImplementing Entity would not meet the requirements set forth in paragraph (a) for the Fiscal Years covered by such review, theProject Implementing Entity shall promptly take all necessary measures (including, without limitation, adjustments of the structureor levels of its rates) in order to meet such requirements.
